title: Baofeng
author: Baofeng
created_time: August 18, 2022, 10:40:23 PMLast edit: May 20, 2023, 11:07:25 PM by Baofeng
content: Ok, it seems that we are going to see Loma back in action, this time it will be against Jamaine Ortiz who beat former champion Jamel Herring recently. We all know that Loma goes back to his hometown Ukraine and enlisted himself to defend the country against the Russians.But now he is back and continue his boxing career (same with his fellow Ukrainians Usyk who will be fighting AJ in Saudi). Not a cherry pick but probably a tune up fight for Loma before facing Haney, assuming both of them win.The fight is slated in October.https://www.badlefthook.com/2022/8/17/23309795/vasiliy-lomachenko-next-fight-jamaine-ortiz-agree-terms-october-top-rank-espn-boxing-news-2022

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: It's a great opportunity for Ortiz for his young career and a good tune fight for Loma heading to the winner of the Kambosos Haney rematch even if Ortiz is good I'll pick Loma to win this fight, Loma is just good to any fighter and he is still in the peek of his career I don't seeÂ  Lopez kind of upset here in this fight, this time Loma knocks better now he cannot afford an upset this time.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Jamel Herring is past his prime when he fought Ortiz if you look at their fight he is not the same Herring we've seen Ortiz is just lucky that he fought a fighter who is on the brink of retirement I don't think it will happen here Ortiz is fast quick and strong and up and coming prospect, but Loma is still in his prime and very eager to get back the title he lost to Kambosos, I think we're going to have a very good fight but I expect Loma to fully dominate this fight from start to finish, Loma knows what's at stake on this fight.

comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on August 18, 2022, 11:29:53 PMJamel Herring is past his prime when he fought Ortiz if you look at their fight he is not the same Herring we've seen Ortiz is just lucky that he fought a fighter who is on the brink of retirement I don't think it will happen here Ortiz is fast quick and strong and up and coming prospect, but Loma is still in his prime and very eager to get back the title he lost to Kambosos, I think we're going to have a very good fight but I expect Loma to fully dominate this fight from start to finish, Loma knows what's at stake on this fight.I was about to say that, when Herring lost to Shakur it was obvious that he is no longer in his prime. Not taking away from the young Ortiz, but it was a good setup for him. And now look at what opportunity he has, knocking on the doors of the great Lomachenko.But then again, it will be hard pressed to see him winning against Loma, maybe we will see some ring rust early, but once he shake that cobwebs, Loma will be too much for the young Ortiz. And then next year, it will be Loma against Haney, that will be exciting match indeed.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Not probably the fight for fans expecting Loma to fight someone on the upper rank. It wouldn't really make a difference if Loma just wait for whoever wins like Kambosos vs Haney. He couldn't demand a rematch with Lopez while Kambosos can with Haney. So what did Jamaine Ortiz do to Top rank that he got this tune-up fight for Loma's come back?

It certainly is only a tune up fight before his next one in the ring which I speculate might not be for the championship against the winner of Haney vs. Kambosos. It might be Lomachenko's next fight after Ortiz that will be the official championship eliminator. The opponent might also be one of the top 5 ranked lightweight boxers with a name. Ryan Garcia or Isaac Cruz?

comments.author: Questat
comments.body: I think Loma will win here, Jamaine Ortiz beat Jamel Herring who lose to Stevenson via KO. He might be a quality fighter but not yet on the level of Loma, Ortiz called himself as "The Technician", but Loma is actually more than a technical boxer, so I guess that Ortiz will be in big trouble.

comments.author: TopTort777
comments.body: I see no big drama in this fight. The combination of Vasily Lomachenko and papa-chenko (that is how people call his father) will be dominant once again. I am not trying to say that Ortiz is bad, simply Lomachenko is too good and experienced. No matter that their have similar boxing record, Loma was fighting more experienced fighters all the time. I expect a TKO in the second part of the fight.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: I guess what interest us more is how is Loma after his long break again, remember that after his lost to Lopez, he comeback strong and dominated his opponents, Nakatani and Comley.Unfortunately, war broke out and he is supposed to fight Kambosos, but Haney was tapped and then get all his belts. So this is a tuneup as others said for Loma and hopefully he is still in his prime and that he can get back all the belts he had once held.

comments.body: Man! I thought I never see him again since he really get home to depend on his country and there was a tendency that he might not return to boxing again. But wow! look at this he will gonna have a fight again. This is another good fight this year since Loma is undoubted will gonna give the spectators some real boxing match here. Ortiz also is a strong opponent and it would be a real challenge for Loma to get back on track.

Ryan Garcia or Isaac Cruz?I thought the WBO preserved Lomachenko as its mandatory due to the war in Ukraine? And even before this announcement, Top Rank already guaranteed undisputed champ Haney that he will take Lomachenko after his Kambosos fight, it also said that Lomachenko will have a tune-up fight too. So this should be that tune-up fight. Ortiz is an exciting fighter although his low KO rate might mean that Loma can be more aggressive to score a KO. I knew these Ukrainian fighters aren't really at their 100% until the war is over. But I hope it is still enough to secure their wins. Boxing fans, stay tuned to this weekend's heavyweight championship rematch between Loma's very close friend Oleksandyr Usyk battling against former champ Anthony Joshua.
